case_vignette: An 8-year-old boy presents with a 2-month history of an asymptomatic rash on the dorsum of his right hand. He and his family have recently moved from a coastal region in Mexico. Medical and family history are otherwise unremarkable. On examination, he has a 2-cm pigmented macular lesion with an irregular outline centrally located on the dorsal aspect of his right hand. The remainder of the physical examination is normal. Dermoscopy rules out a nevoid lesion, and septated filaments are observed on potassium hydroxide (KOH) test.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a rash on the top of my right hand that's been there for about 2 months.
How old are you?
I am 8 years old.
Are you experiencing any other symptoms like itching, pain, or fever?
No, I don't have any itching, pain, or fever.
Has the rash changed in size, shape, or color since you first noticed it?
No, it hasn't changed in size, shape, or color.
Is there a history of skin conditions or allergies in your family?
My family doesn't have a history of skin conditions or allergies.
Have you been exposed to any new soaps, plants, animals, or other potential allergens recently?
No, I haven't been exposed to any new soaps, plants, animals, or other potential allergens.
Have you started using any new medications or had any recent illnesses or vaccinations?
No, I haven't started using any new medications or had recent illnesses or vaccinations.
Is the rash limited to one area or has it spread to other parts of your body?
The rash is just on the top of my right hand.
Does the rash have a distinct pattern or border, and are there any blisters or scales?
The rash has an irregular outline but there are no blisters or scales.
Have you had any recent injuries or insect bites on your right hand where the rash is located?
No, I haven't had any injuries or insect bites on my right hand.

Final Diagnosis: Localized, chronic, non-changing rash without systemic symptoms or known exposure to irritants or allergens suggests the possibility of a benign skin condition like granuloma annulare or a localized form of dermatitis. A clinical examination would be necessary for an accurate diagnosis.
